panel.title: ILS Automation Installer for ACE Controls Applications
panel.preamble: Welcome to demonstration version of the ILS Automation installer for Ignition Applications. Here we install a fictional product called ACE Controls and exercise all panel options of the installer. The table below compares the existing installation of this product, if any, with the versions contained in this new installation. Before continuing, please make sure that you have defined tag providers and database connections for both production and isolation (test) environments.

panel.title: End User License Agreement (EULA)
panel.preamble: Click on the button below to view the license that specifies permissible use of the software to be installed. Select the checkbox to indicate acceptance of the terms. You must accept the license terms to proceed.

panel.title: Save gateway state as an Ignition Backup
panel.preamble: This is an optional step. Once created, a backup allows you to revert the previous state of the application.

panel.title: Clear obsolete files
panel.preamble: This step removes obsolete files installed during one or more previous installations.

panel.title: Interface Definitions
panel.preamble: Specify tag provider and database connections as used by the Ignition Applications. This product requires that both production and test mode versions are specified. The selections hare are used by subsequent screens.

panel.title: Verify User Roles
panel.preamble: Check authentication profiles to verify that at least one of them includes users assigned to each role utilized by the product.
panel.role: Operator - responsible for running the application
Application engineer - responsible for configuring the application

panel.title: Python Code for the ACE Application
panel.preamble: This page loads Python code that supports the ACE Application. The Python is divided into two categories: code developed by ILS Automation that is generic and used in multiple products, and code modified specifically for this application. A third category consists of Java jar files that are referenced by the Python.

artifact.name: Jar Files to Support External Python

panel.title: Custom Icons for Ignition Applications
panel.preamble: Custom icons are used extensively when drawing blocks in the Block Language Toolkit. They may also be found in many of the user screens.

panel.title: Database Create and Alter Scripts for te ACE Application
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the PRODUCTION instance.

panel.title: Database Create and Alter Scripts for Test
panel.preamble: This page provides the opportunity for either creating a new database instance or altering an existing instance to accommodate schema corrections. The actions here are performed against the ISOLATION instance.

panel.title: Install Custom Modules
panel.preamble: This step installs modules necessary for the EMC applications.

panel.title: Install Module for Testing
panel.preamble: This step installs the module that holds the testing framework.

panel.title: Install Tags and UDT Definitions
panel.preamble: This page defines UDTs and tags that are needed by the applications when running in PRODUCTION mode.

panel.title: Install Tags Definitions for Test
panel.preamble: This page defines tags that are used by the Ignition Applications when running in ISOLATION mode.

panel.title: Create alternative Scan Classes
panel.preamble: Create scanclasses referenced by PRODUCTION tags. Scanclasses determine tag poll rates.

panel.title: Install a New ACE Project or Merge Changes into an Existing Project
panel.preamble: ACE is the main Ignition project. This page provides artifacts for a clean, new installation or, alternatively, a merge with an existing version. A merge preserves any user modifications.

panel.title: Install the DbManager Project
panel.preamble: DbManager is a utility for maintenance of application databases. It is not generally user-customizable. The action on this page completely replaces the existing copy.

panel.title: Install SFC Charts in the Global Project
panel.preamble: This page handles installation of charts for various migrated SFC projects. The charts are packaged as Ignition global projects. They completely replace any existing charts of the same name. Multiple chart hierarchies can be updated from this one page.

panel.title: Product Documentation
panel.preamble: The list below contains both user-level and design documents. They may be downloaded individually.

panel.title: Source Distribution
panel.preamble: The Java source for the Application Toolkit and extensions to Sequential function charts are bundled into a single zip file. The source distribution comes complete with Eclipse project files and ant scripts for building. Python source is available directly from its installation in the /user-lib/pylib sub-directory of the Ignition installation.

panel.title: Install test files
panel.preamble: This step adds test scripts to the filesystem.

panel.title: Update Toolkit Properties
panel.preamble: Set properties in the internal database of the Gateway. These particular parameters define extension functions that update the database in response to operator operations on diagrams.

panel.title: Installation Summary
panel.preamble: The list below shows which of the installation steps have been completed. Selecting "Finish" will record the current version of ACE Ignition Applications in the Gateway internal database.

epilog.title: Installation Complete
epilog.preamble: The automated installation and configuration of the ACE Control Ignition Application is complete. There are just a few more manual steps required.
epilog.note: Several modules with active components have been installed. A Gateway restart is required.
Newly created projects are disabled when they are installed. They must be enabled before use. Restart the Gateway first.
